headline.main: Gomes, Johnson Lift Braves Over Marlins 6-3
headline.print_headline: Gomes, Johnson Lift Braves Over Marlins 6-3

docs.snippet: Even though he won 10 games for the marlins last season, Tom Koehler isn't considering himself a lock for Miami's rotation....
docs.lead_paragraph: Even though he won 10 games for the marlins last season, Tom Koehler isn't considering himself a lock for Miami's rotation.

headline.main: Judge Sets $500k Bail for Man Charged in College Stabbing
headline.print_headline: Judge Sets $500k Bail for Man Charged in College Stabbing

docs.snippet: A Baltimore judge has set bail at $500,000 for a Maryland university student accused of slashing two other students with a pocket knife outside a campus dining hall....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Baltimore judge has set bail at $500,000 for a Maryland university student accused of slashing two other students with a pocket knife outside a campus dining hall.

headline.main: For Hong Kong, a Chill Sets In as Rich China Tourists Shop Elsewhere
headline.print_headline: For Hong Kong, a Chill Sets In as Rich China Tourists Shop Elsewhere

docs.snippet: Chinese tourists are rapidly deserting Hong Kong, leaving retailers who built businesses around once insatiable demand from mainland neighbors with bigger but emptier stores and squeezing the whole city's visitor-dependent economy....
docs.lead_paragraph: Chinese tourists are rapidly deserting Hong Kong, leaving retailers who built businesses around once insatiable demand from mainland neighbors with bigger but emptier stores and squeezing the whole city's visitor-dependent economy.

headline.main: Op-Talk: How Domestic Violence Costs Women Money

docs.snippet: Survivors need help not just with the physical effects of abuse, but with the financial ones, too....
docs.abstract: Survivors need help not just with the physical effects of abuse, but with the financial ones, too.

headline.main: GM CEO Barra to Be Questioned in Ignition-Switches Lawsuit
headline.print_headline: GM CEO Barra to Be Questioned in Ignition-Switches Lawsuit

docs.snippet: General Motors CEO Mary Barra will be questioned this fall by lawyers suing GM over its defective ignition switches....
docs.lead_paragraph: General Motors CEO Mary Barra will be questioned this fall by lawyers suing GM over its defective ignition switches.

docs.snippet: Tesla unveiled software upgrades that will include allowing drivers to go hands-free, about a year ahead of the competition. It also has a feature that wil warn Model S drivers before they run out of battery power. Bobbi Rebell reports....
docs.lead_paragraph: Tesla unveiled software upgrades that will include allowing drivers to go hands-free, about a year ahead of the competition. It also has a feature that wil warn Model S drivers before they run out of battery power. Bobbi Rebell reports.

headline.main: Report: San Francisco Officer Resigns Amid Probe of Texts
headline.print_headline: Report: San Francisco Officer Resigns Amid Probe of Texts

docs.snippet: A lawyer says one of four San Francisco police officers under department investigation over racist and homophobic texts has resigned....
docs.lead_paragraph: A lawyer says one of four San Francisco police officers under department investigation over racist and homophobic texts has resigned.

headline.main: Pair Plead Guilty After Leaving Kids in Car for Wine Tasting
headline.print_headline: Pair Plead Guilty After Leaving Kids in Car for Wine Tasting

docs.snippet: A Washington man and his wife have pleaded guilty to misdemeanor charges after authorities said they left their two toddlers alone in a car for an hour while they attended a wine tasting....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Washington man and his wife have pleaded guilty to misdemeanor charges after authorities said they left their two toddlers alone in a car for an hour while they attended a wine tasting.

headline.main: Emails Sought of Nearly a Dozen U.S. State Department Workers Under Clinton
headline.print_headline: Emails Sought of Nearly a Dozen U.S. State Department Workers Under Clinton

docs.snippet: Congress has subpoenaed the emails of "close to a dozen" people who worked in the State Department for Hillary Clinton when she was secretary of state, the chairman of the U.S. House committee investigating the 2012 Benghazi attacks said on Thursd...
docs.lead_paragraph: Congress has subpoenaed the emails of "close to a dozen" people who worked in the State Department for Hillary Clinton when she was secretary of state, the chairman of the U.S. House committee investigating the 2012 Benghazi attacks said on Thursday.

headline.main: Donetsk orphanage struggles to shelter children from war
headline.sub: Donetsk orphanage struggles to shelter children from war

docs.snippet: As a fragile Ukraine ceasefire comes under renewed strain, an orphanage in rebel-held Donetsk struggles to shield its young charges from the year-long conflict. Mana Rabiee reports....
docs.lead_paragraph: As a fragile Ukraine ceasefire comes under renewed strain, an orphanage in rebel-held Donetsk struggles to shield its young charges from the year-long conflict. Mana Rabiee reports.
